channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Investigating the Robustness of Modelling Decisions for Few-Shot Cross-Topic Stance Detection: A Preregistered Study
item.description: In this paper, we investigate the robustness of operationalization choices for few-shot stance detection, with special attention to modelling stance across different topics.

item.title: Can only LLMs do Reasoning?: Potential of Small Language Models in Task Planning
item.description: This leads us to pose a question: If small LMs can be trained to reason in chains within a single domain, would even small LMs be good task planners for the robots?

item.title: Improving Factual Accuracy of Neural Table-to-Text Output by Addressing Input Problems in ToTTo
item.description: Neural Table-to-Text models tend to hallucinate, producing texts that contain factual errors.

item.title: Forget NLI, Use a Dictionary: Zero-Shot Topic Classification for Low-Resource Languages with Application to Luxembourgish
item.description: A common method for ZSC is to fine-tune a language model on a Natural Language Inference (NLI) dataset and then use it to infer the entailment between the input document and the target labels.

item.title: Dynamic Prompt Optimizing for Text-to-Image Generation
item.description: Users assign weights or alter the injection time steps of certain words in the text prompts to improve the quality of generated images.

item.title: Nonparametric Modern Hopfield Models
item.description: We present a nonparametric construction for deep learning compatible modern Hopfield models and utilize this framework to debut an efficient variant.

item.title: Superior Genetic Algorithms for the Target Set Selection Problem Based on Power-Law Parameter Choices and Simple Greedy Heuristics
item.description: Besides providing a superior algorithm for the TSS problem, this work shows that randomized parameter choices and elementary greedy heuristics can give better results than complex algorithms and costly parameter tuning.

item.title: VoltaVision: A Transfer Learning model for electronic component classification
item.description: In this paper, we analyze the effectiveness of transfer learning on classifying electronic components.

item.title: SCAResNet: A ResNet Variant Optimized for Tiny Object Detection in Transmission and Distribution Towers
item.description: This demonstrates the advantages of our SCAResNet in detecting transmission and distribution towers and its value in tiny object detection.

item.title: Large language models as oracles for instantiating ontologies with domain-specific knowledge
item.description: To mitigate that issue, we propose a novel domain-independent approach to automatically instantiate ontologies with domain-specific knowledge, by leveraging on large language models (LLMs) as oracles.

item.title: A Comparison of Methods for Evaluating Generative IR
item.description: Given that Gen-IR systems do not generate responses from a fixed set, we assume that methods for Gen-IR evaluation must largely depend on LLM-generated labels.

item.title: Continual Learning with Weight Interpolation
item.description: Continual learning poses a fundamental challenge for modern machine learning systems, requiring models to adapt to new tasks while retaining knowledge from previous ones.

item.title: No Time to Train: Empowering Non-Parametric Networks for Few-shot 3D Scene Segmentation
item.description: To reduce the reliance on large-scale datasets, recent works in 3D segmentation resort to few-shot learning.

item.title: Label Propagation for Zero-shot Classification with Vision-Language Models
item.description: We leverage the graph structure of the unlabeled data and introduce ZLaP, a method based on label propagation (LP) that utilizes geodesic distances for classification.

item.title: BEAR: A Unified Framework for Evaluating Relational Knowledge in Causal and Masked Language Models
item.description: We release the BEAR datasets and an open-source framework that implements the probing approach to the research community to facilitate the evaluation and development of LMs.

item.title: A Dataset for Physical and Abstract Plausibility and Sources of Human Disagreement
item.description: We present a novel dataset for physical and abstract plausibility of events in English.

item.title: Fusing Dictionary Learning and Support Vector Machines for Unsupervised Anomaly Detection
item.description: We introduce a new anomaly detection model that unifies the OC-SVM and DL residual functions into a single composite objective, subsequently solved through K-SVD-type iterative algorithms.

item.title: Generalizable Temperature Nowcasting with Physics-Constrained RNNs for Predictive Maintenance of Wind Turbine Components
item.description: Machine learning plays an important role in the operation of current wind energy production systems.

item.title: Model Selection with Model Zoo via Graph Learning
item.description: Pre-trained deep learning (DL) models are increasingly accessible in public repositories, i. e., model zoos.

item.title: Benchmarking and Improving Compositional Generalization of Multi-aspect Controllable Text Generation
item.description: Compositional generalization, representing the model's ability to generate text with new attribute combinations obtained by recombining single attributes from the training data, is a crucial property for multi-aspect controllable text generation (MCTG) methods.

item.title: Schroedinger's Threshold: When the AUC doesn't predict Accuracy
item.description: The Area Under Curve measure (AUC) seems apt to evaluate and compare diverse models, possibly without calibration.

item.title: MonoCD: Monocular 3D Object Detection with Complementary Depths
item.description: Monocular 3D object detection has attracted widespread attention due to its potential to accurately obtain object 3D localization from a single image at a low cost.

item.title: Edisum: Summarizing and Explaining Wikipedia Edits at Scale
item.description: To overcome this problem and help editors write useful edit summaries, we propose a model for recommending edit summaries generated by a language model trained to produce good edit summaries given the representation of an edit diff.

item.title: Integrating Hyperparameter Search into GramML
item.description: This is very important for the practice of machine learning, as it allows building strong baselines quickly, improving the efficiency of the data scientists, and reducing the time to production.

item.title: Sparse Concept Bottleneck Models: Gumbel Tricks in Contrastive Learning
item.description: We propose a novel architecture and method of explainable classification with Concept Bottleneck Models (CBMs).

item.title: Goldfish: An Efficient Federated Unlearning Framework
item.description: To address the challenge of low validity in existing machine unlearning algorithms, we propose a novel loss function.

item.title: ChangeMamba: Remote Sensing Change Detection with Spatio-Temporal State Space Model
item.description: For the change decoder, which is available in all three architectures, we propose three spatio-temporal relationship modeling mechanisms, which can be naturally combined with the Mamba architecture and fully utilize its attribute to achieve spatio-temporal interaction of multi-temporal features and obtain accurate change information.

item.title: LancBiO: dynamic Lanczos-aided bilevel optimization via Krylov subspace
item.description: As a result, the constructed subspace is able to dynamically and incrementally approximate the Hessian inverse vector product with less effort and thus leads to a favorable estimate of the hyper-gradient.

item.title: EASSE-DE: Easier Automatic Sentence Simplification Evaluation for German
item.description: In this work, we propose EASSE-multi, a framework for easier automatic sentence evaluation for languages other than English.

item.title: A Comprehensive Survey on Self-Supervised Learning for Recommendation
item.description: Recommender systems play a crucial role in tackling the challenge of information overload by delivering personalized recommendations based on individual user preferences.

item.title: Evaluating Generative Language Models in Information Extraction as Subjective Question Correction
item.description: (1) The imprecision of existing evaluation metrics that struggle to effectively gauge semantic consistency between model outputs and ground truth, and (2) The inherent incompleteness of evaluation benchmarks, primarily due to restrictive human annotation schemas, resulting in underestimated LLM performances.

item.title: AI and the Problem of Knowledge Collapse
item.description: While large language models are trained on vast amounts of diverse data, they naturally generate output towards the 'center' of the distribution.

item.title: CoMat: Aligning Text-to-Image Diffusion Model with Image-to-Text Concept Matching
item.description: We further attribute this phenomenon to the diffusion model's insufficient condition utilization, which is caused by its training paradigm.

item.title: Is CLIP the main roadblock for fine-grained open-world perception?
item.description: Modern applications increasingly demand flexible computer vision models that adapt to novel concepts not encountered during training.

item.title: Outlier-Efficient Hopfield Layers for Large Transformer-Based Models
item.description: Interestingly, this memory model manifests a model-based interpretation of an outlier-efficient attention mechanism ($\text{Softmax}_1$): it is an approximation of the memory retrieval process of $\mathtt{OutEffHop}$.

item.title: How does Multi-Task Training Affect Transformer In-Context Capabilities? Investigations with Function Classes
item.description: Large language models (LLM) have recently shown the extraordinary ability to perform unseen tasks based on few-shot examples provided as text, also known as in-context learning (ICL).

item.title: HAPNet: Toward Superior RGB-Thermal Scene Parsing via Hybrid, Asymmetric, and Progressive Heterogeneous Feature Fusion
item.description: In this study, we take one step toward this new research area by exploring a feasible strategy to fully exploit VFM features for RGB-thermal scene parsing.

item.title: BiSHop: Bi-Directional Cellular Learning for Tabular Data with Generalized Sparse Modern Hopfield Model
item.description: We introduce the \textbf{B}i-Directional \textbf{S}parse \textbf{Hop}field Network (\textbf{BiSHop}), a novel end-to-end framework for deep tabular learning.

item.title: Learning Transferable Negative Prompts for Out-of-Distribution Detection
item.description: Existing prompt learning methods have shown certain capabilities in Out-of-Distribution (OOD) detection, but the lack of OOD images in the target dataset in their training can lead to mismatches between OOD images and In-Distribution (ID) categories, resulting in a high false positive rate.

item.title: A Comparative Analysis of Word-Level Metric Differential Privacy: Benchmarking The Privacy-Utility Trade-off
item.description: The application of Differential Privacy to Natural Language Processing techniques has emerged in relevance in recent years, with an increasing number of studies published in established NLP outlets.

item.title: Know Your Neighbors: Improving Single-View Reconstruction via Spatial Vision-Language Reasoning
item.description: We propose KYN, a novel method for single-view scene reconstruction that reasons about semantic and spatial context to predict each point's density.

item.title: To Search or to Recommend: Predicting Open-App Motivation with Neural Hawkes Process
item.description: The model, referred to as Neural Hawkes Process-based Open-App Motivation prediction model (NHP-OAM), employs a hierarchical transformer and a novel intensity function to encode multiple factors, and open-app motivation prediction layer to integrate time and user-specific information for predicting users' open-app motivations.

item.title: JUICER: Data-Efficient Imitation Learning for Robotic Assembly
item.description: While learning from demonstrations is powerful for acquiring visuomotor policies, high-performance imitation without large demonstration datasets remains challenging for tasks requiring precise, long-horizon manipulation.

item.title: Foundation Model for Advancing Healthcare: Challenges, Opportunities, and Future Directions
item.description: To answer these questions, a comprehensive and deep survey of the challenges, opportunities, and future directions of HFMs is presented in this survey.

item.title: Benchmarking Parameter Control Methods in Differential Evolution for Mixed-Integer Black-Box Optimization
item.description: Although the PCM of SHADE is state-of-the-art for numerical black-box optimization, our results show its poor performance for mixed-integer black-box optimization.

item.title: nicolay-r at SemEval-2024 Task 3: Using Flan-T5 for Reasoning Emotion Cause in Conversations with Chain-of-Thought on Emotion States
item.description: Inspired by the most recent advances in Chain-of-Thought, in this work, we exploit the existing three-hop reasoning approach (THOR) to perform large language model instruction-tuning for answering: emotion states (THOR-state), and emotion caused by one speaker to the other (THOR-cause).

item.title: Real-time Noise Source Estimation of a Camera System from an Image and Metadata
item.description: It also serves as a basis to include more advanced noise sources, or as part of an automatic countermeasure feedback-loop to approach fully reliable machines.

item.title: Approximate Gradient Coding for Privacy-Flexible Federated Learning with Non-IID Data
item.description: This work focuses on the challenges of non-IID data and stragglers/dropouts in federated learning.

item.title: Learning From Simplicial Data Based on Random Walks and 1D Convolutions
item.description: Triggered by limitations of graph-based deep learning methods in terms of computational expressivity and model flexibility, recent years have seen a surge of interest in computational models that operate on higher-order topological domains such as hypergraphs and simplicial complexes.

item.title: Riemannian L-systems: Modeling growing forms in curved spaces
item.description: To model these forms growing in curved spaces, we thus extended the formalism of L-systems to non-Euclidean spaces.
